summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 10, 2019. The sheets are for different tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) and detail the required observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate monitoring at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Standard 30-minute checks were conducted on inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, as per protocol for administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets detailing 30-minute inmate checks for July 10, 2019.
It outlines the strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The checks were conducted in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight.
No specific inmate names are listed on these particular check sheets; they are blank forms with time slots for staff signatures.
